In contrast, increases in precipitation can cause changes to soil texture and structure, with increases in run-off causing reduction in top soil (which is often the most productive part of a soil horizon). The impact will depend on the intensity and duration of weather conditions, as well as the location.

Effect on Variability: Risk as heavy raindrops on bare soil causes soil surface to seal increasing erodibility. Increased soil break up and vulnerability to water erosion.
